0.Pros: The hours are flexible. Also, if you want to break into lower level management it is fairly easy. They offer help with college so long as its business management or some related major and I think English classes are offered.
0.Cons: Low pay, long hours, the stress of working in customer service, and it is difficult for some people to get full time hours. Most employees are getting scaled back to part time or getting sent home early.

1.Pros: Food, break, certain customers, and certain friends
1.Cons: No training, no help with your orders, and mean management.

2.Pros: Good co workers. They are really friendly and help you in any way/
2.Cons: Management sucks. The Human Resource lady always put you last especially if you need something from HR right away. Sigh.

3.Pros: Not a very good place to work or advance.. Only worked 5 days before I left
3.Cons: Bad place to work......... Would never go back sorry not sorry good bye

4.Pros: Lots of new and interesting people to meet everyday.
4.Cons: Pay was too low for work expected

5.Pros: Supervisors willing to work with your schedule. The job itself is easy to learn.
5.Cons: Management would make me take my lunch 2 1/2 hours into my 8 hour shift. I'd get zero breaks after that.

6.Pros: The managers are generally nice and understanding people, and you get a 50% discount on the food that you buy.
6.Cons: Very inefficient. Most of the time my requests for days off (including days I was out of town, at mandatory school events, and even getting surgery) were disregarded, and it was stressful to find someone to cover my shifts. Rude customers.

7.Pros: so you could have your own income never have to ask any one for hand outs
7.Cons: missing out on fun things but on the good side u would have money

8.Pros: None that I can think of. Just something to keep you busy until you find something else.
8.Cons: low pay after working for two years. Managers don't care about keeping the place clean.

9.Cons: Working with younger ppl who aren't always motivated
